CTO noun [U]
(TIME OFF)
Add to word list
Add to word list
abbreviation for compensatory time off: time that an employee who has worked extra hours may take off from work instead of being paid for the extra hours: CTO agreements allow certain employees to voluntarily select overtime compensation in the form of time off.
More examplesFewer examplesWhat does CTO mean on a wage slip?CTO is paid time off given to an employee instead of overtime pay. The pay or CTO should be paid at the correct rate of time and a half.

CTO noun [U]
(JOB TITLE)
abbreviation for chief technology officer: someone with a high position in a business who is responsible for technical and scientific issues: He served as the CTO of Ingredients.com before launching his own e-business consultancy.
More examplesFewer examplesBill Spence is CTO at Information Today, Inc.Visualization, according to CTO Ramao Rao, is "an ingredient technology, not an application in itself".The CTO function has its origins in both research & development (R&D) and engineering
